well-known reputation for creating dark witches and wizards

ambition - want to have the best status possible

strive to do what is wise.
good sense of humor and are often quirky.
lead through wisdom and they will always use their brains to resolve any situation.
creativity - not only intelligent, but very unpredictable and creative with their spellwork
good looks, provide the prettiest faces

cliques - they prefer to stay to themselves and study, rarely interacting with others during assignments

the House colours were chosen; blue and bronze represent the sky and eagle feathers respectively
learning, wisdom, wit, and intellect in its members.
tend to be curious about the world and pay attention to the world around them.
known to be logical and rational.
competitive when it comes to academic success
have little rivalry with the other houses
they tended to side with Gryffindor in its rivalry with Slytherin, as did Hufflepuff house.
they’re well-known for being welcoming and encouraging of creativity, eccentricity and individuality and being very accepting.

corresponds roughly to the element of air

most inclusive among the four houses
valuing hard work, dedication, patience, loyalty, and fair play

House colours were chosen: yellow represented wheat, while black was emblematic of soil.
hard-working, friendly, loyal, honest and rather impartial.
known to have a strong moral code, and a sense of right and wrong.
appears to have the least rivalry with the other houses
house that produced the fewest dark wizards through out its history
dormitory is a quite cosy and welcoming place
are not as competitive as the other houses, and are more modest about their accomplishments.
Their cheerful and friendly demeanour can probably account for this property of the House.
humble - they are modest and meek
benevolence - They do the right thing because it's the right thing, not for glory or selfish reasons
friendly - they don't have biases based on stereotypes like the other Houses
hard-working - they don't cheat or look for loop holes. Just good old fashioned work
lack of drive - they have a very low competitive nature. This hurts them when it comes to points.
take the slow route and don't always make the cut
they never brag or talk about their accomplishments, leading many to think they lack powerful wizards
this house has the most "good" people
Their mascot is a badger, and their colors are yellow and black
Their main purpose in life is to be kind and generous and to spare people’s feelings.
They are also smart and many are very adventurous and courageous.
However, their patient nature and their desire to make others happy are stronger.
Earth is the element of stability and in this case deals with nature-like motherly affection
he emblematic animal is a lion, and its colours are scarlet and gold.
Sir Nicholas de Mimsy-Porpington, also known as "Nearly Headless Nick" is the House ghost.
corresponds roughly to the element of fire
the colours scarlet and gold were chosen to represent the house
scarlet representing the mane and tail and gold representing the coat
its members are generally regarded as brave, though sometimes to the point of recklessness.
Gryffindors and Slytherins have shared a fierce house rivalry since their founders
Members of other houses might have felt that Gryffindor received favouritism
Common Room is located in one of the castle's towers (Gryffindor Tower)
Loyal, brave, courageous, daring, adventurous, chivalrous – those are the traits of a true Gryffindor.
fight for what is right and they are usually the ones at the head of the pack
have several other good qualities that often make them well-suited to other houses.
daring - even when they don't have all the information, they will be the first to jump to action.
They seek glory for the mere sake of getting glory, not money or academics or a position of power
athletic - tend to produce the best athletes as well as the best duelers.
popularity - due to their lack of restraint and athletic abilities, they tend to produce the most popular kids
chivalrous - they choose to do what's noble over what's lawfully right
arrogance- Gryffindors break rules so often they get a high opinion of themselves.
recklessness - having too much nerve can lead them to take risk in situations where they are not in control.
self-righteousness - Gryffindors tend to think their way of doing things is the best way to do things because they take the "noble" road
an eye for an eye - If they think a certain person deserves to be treated badly, they will do it.
their element is fire. Fire is the element of passion, and symbolizes wild emotions and lack of restraint.
this is the house of most of the protagonists, and therefore meant to symbolize "good", at least in the beginning of the series
The mascot is a lion, and the colors are red and gold
on 7th floor, filled with big fireplaces and knight's armor
Their ghost is Nearly Headless Nick
rash, careless, thoughtless, incautious, heedless, unheeding
devil-may-care, hotheaded; irresponsible, wild, foolhardy, headlong
diffident, timid, reserved, retiring, media-shy, reticent
keeping one's light under a bushel
stuck-up, toffee-nosed, fancy-pants, snotty, jumped up, too big for one's boots, bigheaded
knight errantry, the knightly code, knighthood
